de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui

Class GuiPlace

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui.GuiElement
      • de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui.GuiNode
        • de.lambeck.pned.elements.gui.GuiPlace
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGuiElement, IGuiNode, IGuiPlace, IHasZValue, ISelectable, IElement, INode, IPlace

    public class GuiPlace
extends GuiNode
implements IGuiPlace
    Implements the places for the GUI model of the Petri net.

    This means that they have properties which play a role in the GUI only. (e.g. size of nodes, colors)
    Author:
    Thomas Lambeck, 4128320

      Stores whether this place is an end place candidate (if there is more than 1 place without output arcs in this workflow net).

        Parameters:
        id - The id
        name - The name of this place
        p - The center point
        zOrder - The height level
        initialTokens - Specifies the initial tokens count of this place.

      • setGuiStartPlace

        public void setGuiStartPlace(boolean b)
        Description copied from interface: IGuiPlace
        Sets this places status as the real (unambiguous) start place.
        Specified by:
        setGuiStartPlace in interface IGuiPlace
        Parameters:
        b - True = this is the real (unambiguous) start place; false = this is not a start place or there are multiple candidates

      • setGuiStartPlaceCandidate

        public void setGuiStartPlaceCandidate(boolean b)
        Description copied from interface: IGuiPlace
        Use this method to set this places status as a start place candidate if there is more than 1 place without input arcs. Start place candidates will be highlighted slightly different to (unambiguous) start places.
        Specified by:
        setGuiStartPlaceCandidate in interface IGuiPlace
        Parameters:
        b - Set to true if this is the start place; otherwise false.

      • setGuiEndPlace

        Description copied from interface: IGuiPlace

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        b - True = this is the real (unambiguous) end place; false = this is not an end place or there are multiple candidates

      • setGuiEndPlaceCandidate

        public void setGuiEndPlaceCandidate(boolean b)
        Description copied from interface: IGuiPlace
        Use this method to set this places status as an end place candidate if there is more than 1 place without output arcs. End place candidates will be highlighted slightly different to (unambiguous) end places.
        Specified by:
        setGuiEndPlaceCandidate in interface IGuiPlace
        Parameters:
        b - Set to true if this is the end place; otherwise false.

      • drawTokens

        private void drawTokens(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Draws the "tokens" circle in the center of the shape. Uses the private attribute tokensSizePercentage to determine the tokens circle size.
        Parameters:

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.awt.Point p)
        Description copied from interface: IGuiElement
        Checks if a Point is within the shape.

        Note that this refers to the shape of this node itself (place, transition) only. It does not take the area of the label into account!
        Specified by:
        contains in interface IGuiElement
        Parameters:
        p - the Point to check
        Returns:
        true if the Point is within the shape

      • getArcAnchor

        public java.awt.Point getArcAnchor(java.awt.Point target)
        Description copied from interface: IGuiNode
        This method returns the anchor location for an arc from/towards the node. This anchor is located at the border of the node.
        Specified by:
        getArcAnchor in interface IGuiNode
        Parameters:
        target - The target/source of the arc
        Returns:
        The position for start/end of an arc
